item.title: PlayStation Adds New Classic Console Themes To PS5
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-adds-new-classic-console-themes-to-ps5/

The PlayStation 30th Anniversary celebration is continuing with a fun little feature that will certainly scratch the nostalgia itch. For a limited time, PlayStation 5 users can change various parts of the system’s startup.

Options include the console’s bootup options, sound effects, background colors, and general theme. There is a theme for the first four PlayStation consoles to choose from.

You can check out the examples below of the looks below:

How To Get The Classic Themes For PS5

If you want to check them out for yourself, simple follow these steps:

  • Go to your PlayStation 5 Settings
  • Choose “PlayStation 30th Anniversary”
  • Under “Appearance and Sound” choose which option you’d like: 30th Anniversary, PlayStation 1, PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, or PlayStation 4.

And that’s it. There’s no mention of how long this feature will be available for players, so take advantage of it now if you want to enjoy some of PlayStation’s past in a different way.

It’s worth noting that, no matter which you pick, the base bootup sequence animation will be the original PlayStation’s. You can check that out below.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the list of game’s for sale in PlayStation’s 30th Anniversary sale. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Does Path of Exile 2 Have Co-op? Multiplayer Explained

Path of Exile 2 having any form of co-op or multiplayer would be a huge win and add longevity, so let’s find out everything we know.

All Path of Exile 2 PC System Requirements—Minimum & Recommended Specs

Path of Exile 2’s system requirements and minimum and recommended specs are important to PC players, so let’s run through them for you.

What’s the Full Character List in Marvel Rivals?

The Marvel Rivals Launch Trailer has revealed that five more characters will be joining the game at launch, revealing the full character list of the game.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Install Size is 131GB

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle install size has leaked online at 131.69GB.

item.title: Sony Releases New PlayStation 30th Anniversary “Thank You” Video
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/sony-releases-new-playstation-30th-anniversary-thank-you-video/

On December 3, it’ll be 30 years since the original PlayStation first launched in Japan. A system that changed the course of the industry, PlayStation has been at the top of the console market for three decades now. To start the celebration, not only is Sony holding a pretty massive sale on the PlayStation Store, but the company has released a new “Thank You” video for its fans.

“For the past three decades, we’ve shared an incredible journey, building stories and shaping experiences together,” Sony says in the video description. “Along the way, we’ve found adventure, laughter, and lasting memories that go far beyond any one moment. We’ve forged new friendships and redefined what gaming is all about. Thank you for being part of this journey — we couldn’t have done it without you.”

The two-minute video shows some of the biggest franchises in the console’s history with various messages about what PlayStation “is about”. You can check it out for yourself below.

While December 3 marks the official 30th anniversary of the PlayStation, the console didn’t release in North America and Europe until September 1995. That means there’s still another nine months of celebration to happen, and plenty of more time for PlayStation to say “Thank You”.

What are your biggest PlayStation memories? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what game studio Tencent just acquired. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Does Path of Exile 2 Have Co-op? Multiplayer Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/does-path-of-exile-2-have-co-op-multiplayer-explained/

Path of Exile 2 is coming for the crown of ARPG king. It’s no secret the original PoE has co-op and multiplayer, so I’m here to clear up any questions and confusions relating to Path of Exile 2’s potential co-op and multiplayer—it would be nice to have someone to clear the path with.

Multiplayer takes many forms in 2024: Online multiplayer shooters like Black Ops 6, couch co-op tag teams in It Takes Two, and outrageous tests of patience such as Chained Together. I personally love single-player games as much as anyone, but you can’t beat getting together for some harmonious co-op or multiplayer action.

The nature of Path of Exile 2 makes it perfect for either form of gameplay. 2013’s PoE incorporated co-op multiplayer into its action, but this doesn’t mean Path of Exile 2 continues on the multiplayer co-op theme. Let’s see what the developer is cooking up.

Is Path of Exile 2 Multiplayer Co-op?

Good news! Path of Exile 2 features both online multiplayer and local couch co-op for you to enjoy the game with other people, either via wi-fi, or sitting next to someone.

The confirmation comes from Grinding Gear Games itself via an official YouTube announcement trailer and the official FAQ.

Local Couch Co-op

If you consult the Path of Exile 2 frequently asked questions post, under the query asking, “Is couch co-op available in Early Access?,” the answer says, “Yes, you can play Path of Exile 2 in couch co-op mode on a single account right from the start. The second player will be able to create a character on that account.”

No waiting around and no kerfuffle here—it’s immediate access to local couch co-op with a player of your choosing. Furthermore, the “Path of Exile 2 – Console Announcement Trailer | PS5 Games” trailer also confirmed couch co-op was slated for Path of Exile 2.

Online Multiplayer Co-op

Hammering home the notion of online multiplayer and co-op for Path of Exile 2 is the announcement trailer I referenced above. The trailer says “Online multiplayer play requires PlayStation Plus membership.” It also mentions crossplay for Path of Exile 2 too—so you and your friends don’t need to play PoE 2 on the same format.

Check out the cool trailer below.

Are you interested in the local couch co-op side of things? Or is the prospect of online multiplayer the main pull? Drop a comment to let us know, before you get exiled. Plus, keep on top of the latest PoE 2 details including the title’s system requirements, and its array of classes.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Tencent Acquires New Game Studio
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/tencent-acquires-new-game-studio/

Tencent has acquired another new game studio, Chinese studio Kuro Games.

First reported by Youxi Putao — then found by Gematsu — , Tencent has purchased 37% of the Wuthering Waves developer’s shares. When adding it to the 24.4% it already owned, the new acquisition gives the company 51.4% of the shares, and a controlling stake in the company.

The purchase also makes Tencent the only external shareholder of the company.

According to Kuro Games’ internal memo to staff, the studio will continue to work independently. It was iterated that “operational strategy will remain unchanged”. An example used in the memo was Tencent’s ownership in Riot Games and Supercell.

“Based on our past collaborative experiences with Tencent, we firmly believe that this external shareholder change will provide Kuro with a more stable external environment, further benefiting our future independent operational strategies and long-term development,” the internal memo reads via machine translation.

“Over the past decade, our original intention of creating games has never changed, and it will remain unchanged in the next decade. We will continue to love our players, our games, and our team.”

Kuro Games is set to release Version 2.0 of Wuthering Waves on January 2.

What do you think of Tencent buying another game studio? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the free games coming to PlayStation Plus subscribers in December. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Battlestate Teases Terminal in New Escape from Tarkov Images
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/terminal-tarkov-images-nikita/

Battlestate Games’ Nikita Buyanov has posted a series of images on social media showcasing Terminal, the potential final map in Escape from Tarkov. For months, talk about the spearhead extraction shooter has been centred around the last step that players are waiting for – the ability to escape from Tarkov.

Alongside the images, which showcase a dark and brooding map, Buyanov wrote: ‘The place where it all ends?’

The End of All Things

When Escape from Tarkov finally hits a 1.0 release, it’ll be delivered with the ability to finally escape from Tarkov. That has been the goal for the last decade or so, and it’ll be a way to finally ‘complete’ the game.

The ultimate endgame objective was teased today on social media by Nikita Buyanov, the head honcho at Battlestate Games:

Escaping from Tarkov is something that has only ever been possible by powering down and stepping away from the desk – but soon, players will be able to do that after firmly completing the game. The only issue is that we have no idea what that’ll look like. Could it be some kind of ‘prestige’ system, allowing players to complete the game over and over again to earn new rewards?

Nobody knows.

The images showcased by Buyanov don’t reveal too much. It’s an industrial area, which we knew already based on the ‘port’ setting on the map, but something that’s never been seen before is a submarine docked in the port. Players have already theorised that’s how we’ll finally escape from Tarkov.

What do you think of Terminal? Do you want to finally break free of Escape from Tarkov? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that PlayStation is hosting a massive sale

item.title: All Path of Exile 2 PC System Requirements—Minimum & Recommended Specs
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-path-of-exile-2-pc-system-requirements-minimum-recommended-specs/

Path of Exile 2 is the first proper PoE sequel, and ARPG fans are sharpening their swords at the prospect. If you’re interested in Path of Exile 2 on PC, we have the full system requirements, the minimum specs required to run it, and the recommended specs for tip-top gameplay.

Developer Grinding Gear Games hasn’t neglected Path of Exile, instead, it has spent the better part of a decade providing new expansions for the OG title. However, the time has come for a fully-fledged sequel to enter the game. Path of Exile 2 arrives 11 years after its predecessor, and I think I speak for all ARPG fans when I say the market needs fresh blood.

Blizzard’s Diablo 4 is undoubtedly king and Vessel of Hatred is set to continue the series’s dominance. Many fans of the genre are chomping at the bit for Path of Exile 2 though, and its system requirements and PC specs could be crucial factors in its success.

Path of Exile 2 Minimum Requirements on PC

Minimum requirements always do what they say on the box. Path of Exile 2, in this case, has a bare minimum set of PC specs needing to be matched to play the free-to-play title at all. Being able to play is better than not, and I think you’ll be pleased to hear PoE 2’s minimum specs don’t demand the world.

Before we get into the specs, it’s highly recommended you have 3GB of VRAM to run Path of Exile 2 smoothly.

Here are all the Path of Exile 2 minimum requirements necessary to play the ARPG.

Path of Exile 2 Recommended Requirements on PC

It’s now time to move onto the powerful end of the spectrum. Path of Exile 2 may be top-down and have vast, eye-opening landscapes and vistas, but it’s still a highly detailed title with a lot going on. To prevent your system from overheating or overexerting itself, it would be very handy to meet the recommended requirements to get the most out of PoE 2.

As an additional requirement this time, Solid State Storage is considered a must for the recommended requirements.

Check out the complete recommended requirements below.

Do you think Path of Exile 2 can compete with Diablo 4? Let us know how much you’re looking forward to PoE 2 in the comments below. Plus, don’t miss out on every class in PoE 2, and how to play Early Access.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
